1.text: Hear the word of Jehovah, ye children of Israel; for Jehovah hath a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because there is no truth, nor goodness, nor knowledge of God in the land.

2.text: There is nought but swearing and breaking faith, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery; they break out, and blood toucheth blood.

3.text: Therefore shall the land mourn, and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish, with the beasts of the field and the birds of the heavens; yea, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away.

4.text: Yet let no man strive, neither let any man reprove; for thy people are as they that strive with the priest.

5.text: And thou shalt stumble in the day, and the prophet also shall stumble with thee in the night; and I will destroy thy mother.

6.text: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I also will forget thy children.

7.text: As they were multiplied, so they sinned against me: I will change their glory into shame.

8.text: They feed on the sin of my people, and set their heart on their iniquity.

9.text: And it shall be, like people, like priest; and I will punish them for their ways, and will requite them their doings.

10.text: And they shall eat, and not have enough; they shall play the harlot, and shall not increase; because they have left off taking heed to Jehovah.

11.text: Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the understanding.

12.text: My people ask counsel at their stock, and their staff declareth unto them; for the spirit of whoredom hath caused them to err, and they have played the harlot, departing from under their God.

13.text: They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and terebinths, because the shadow thereof is good: therefore your daughters play the harlot, and your brides commit adultery.

14.text: I will not punish your daughters when they play the harlot, nor your brides when they commit adultery; for the men themselves go apart with harlots, and they sacrifice with the prostitutes; and the people that doth not understand shall be overthrown.

15.text: Though thou, Israel, play the harlot, yet let not Judah offend; and come not ye unto Gilgal, neither go ye up to Beth-aven, nor swear, As Jehovah liveth.

16.text: For Israel hath behaved himself stubbornly, like a stubborn heifer: now will Jehovah feed them as a lamb in a large place.

17.text: Ephraim is joined to idols; let him alone.

18.text: Their drink is become sour; they play the harlot continually; her rulers dearly love shame.

19.text: The wind hath wrapped her up in its wings; and they shall be put to shame because of their sacrifices.
